value.title: How to build custom visuals without code with Power BI | Community Webinar
value.excerpt: In this webinar, learn how to create custom visuals without writing code using a project that originated from Microsoft's own Charticulator. Go through multiple examples of building custom visuals to understand how this tool can fill specific reporting needs.   Learn more: https://community.powerbi.com
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/lR_1n4Jcwww" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: PowerBI Tips Introducing Custom Visuals Gallery
value.excerpt: It's 2019 and a good time for another great tool for Power BI.  I'm proud to announce the release of the Custom Visuals Gallery and Charts Building tool.    Gallery (Download Free Visualization Files) http://gallery.powerbi.tips  Charts (Free no code solution to building visualizations) http://charts.powerbi.tips

value.title: PowerBI.tips - PUG - External Tools & Business Ops
value.excerpt: This month Mike and Seth go through the external tools functionality of Power BI desktop.  Additionally, we are introduced to the Amazing Business Ops tool which helps users add External tools into Power BI desktop.   Download Business Ops: https://powerbi.tips/product/business-ops-beta/

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - DAX Studio Full Features Review - By Darren Gosbell
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Darren Gosbell the creator of DAX Studio will be giving a live demo of his tool.    In this live webinar Darren will be giving a full overview of all the features of DAX Studio.  - https://daxstudio.org/documentation/features/  Watch the Full Tutorial Series:

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - DAX Studio Query Performance Tuning - By Marco Russo
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Marco Russo contributor to DAX Studio will be giving us a deep dive and demo around using DAX Studio for Query Performance Tuning.  You will not want to miss this event as Marco is a wealth of knowledge for all things Data Modeling!  Watch the Full Tutorial

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - DAX Studio Release 2.11.1
value.excerpt: DAX Studio has just released it's latest version 2.11.1.  With this release comes a number of great improvements.  Come listen to the Creator Darren Gosbell review the latest features of DAX Studio.  New features include:  - Query Builder  - Query Benchmark  - More Quick access buttons  - Exporting button

value.title: PowerBI.tips - Tutorial - Monkey Tool Introduction - Part 1
value.excerpt: Ken Puls an amazing MVP from Excel Guru has produced an impressive tool, Monkey Tools.  This tool is an Excel Add-in that aids business users to work quickly building Data Models.  Come join us to learn about how this tool can help you in your daily work flow.  Follow Ken  Blog: https://xlguru.ca/blog

value.title: Age Banding in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function   Relationship Based on Between
value.excerpt: One of the most common types of banding or binning is banding based on a range. Let's say, for example,  you want to have a group of customers based on their age group. The age group banding can be created in Power Query at the data transformation stage. It can be created using the Grouping and Binning

value.title: AI and Microsoft Power BI: The realm of impossible - THR2038
value.excerpt: There is a huge demand to get more insight from the data using AI and advanced analytics. In this session, learn how to use current visual and custom visual in Power BI to get more insight from your data. Also, learn how to use current embedded AI features in Power BI.

value.title: Be Careful When Merging on Text Fields in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: Merging two tables in Power Query is one of the most useful transformations to combine data from different datasets, and also create a flatten data structure. However, if you use a text field for merge, then you might see some unexpected results. Here in this video, I share some important considerations

value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. I thought it is good to explain it in a set of videos, the first one here is about what the TreatAs function is and how it can help to build filters and a virtual relationship between two tables. Let's see how you can use this function.

value.title: Caution When Using Variables in DAX and Power BI

Variables in DAX are helpful in both readability and also the performance of your code. However, there are scenarios that you have to be careful when you use variables.
